It's a treasure trove, filled with beautiful booty and a useful object. Greed and avarice have got the better of you, and you decide to leave the island, alone. On your way back home, you come across Pérotin, who sings about giving the money he's earned there, as a gift to this unparalleled melody. Following these adventures, you set off again, accompanied by the object you found on the island.
outcomes.2: Knowing you heroic quest to save the princess, the minstrel decided to sing a song about one of the possible following of you adventure after saving her. But not knowing much about you relationship with the princess, if preferred to tell the story of "The old and the fake monster", in which you are the monster of course. Already knowing the synopsis, Perotin succeeded to not change you, probably because of the under dosage of his drugs. Having not entered in the story, you thank him for this beautiful story, and continue you trip, aware of this useless waste of time.

outcomes.0: This famous bard, not knowing much about the adventurer's work, decides to tell a simple trip in a forest, like you know well. Disappointed about this song, and about Perotin, you choose to continue your adventure.
outcomes.1: Perotin decides to make you live the moment at which you asked him to sing the song. The problem, is that the drugs are so real that you answer the same thing you did, and the minstrel always does the same. It then created an hallucino-temporal loop, because of the talents of Perotin, and your stupidity. Perotin, the only consent of the scene that you live with him had mercy for you at the end of the day and released you from this bad drug.
outcomes.2: Perotin decides to make you see the future, whether it's real or only fiction of your mind, and by the occasion let you earn some money: you get yourself around an old abandoned castle. Looking around you, you find a passage full of traps. You finally avoid all of them, and find a big treasure room. But our favorite minstrel, before the end of your looting, run away with all your booty, leaving you with the main chest, which contains much money, and a surprising item useful to save the princess. Amused, you continue this funny adventure, still a bit under the influence of this drug, called the γ-hydroxybutyric acid according to rumors.

singHero.text: Sing about our life, and our heroic history.

outcomes.0: Taking your words back, you find yourself in an old monastery, in the countryside. Your lover and yourself are staying in this dingy place, harvesting just enough food to survive. You fulfill yourself in this story, due to the overdose of the drugs, that you don't see time going forward. Waking you up, after a few minutes, Perotin tells you that the drugs makes the use feel a few minutes, but those are months. Fortunately, or you would be dead of old age. Meditative, you continue your trip.
outcomes.1: Not understanding your wish, for an uncolored love, Perotin thinks that you are depressive, he then chooses to sing a comforting song, to get you rid of this sudden depression. This song made you feel very well.
outcomes.2: Seeing your knowledge of passionless love, the minstrel takes a liking to you, and makes you a song where your love is you. Caught up in a violent couple's quarrel between you and yourself, the minstrel stops the song, and asks you for a charge for the frantic fight you had with yourself in front of his admirers. Again in the story, you think you're leaving each other, which makes you sad, very sad. So you leave, leaving some money for Pérotin to make up for the inconvenience.

outcomes.0: The minstrel loving his homeland of ever, fills your request and singed the dukes. The duke of the next region came this way, and heard this soft melody, rocking his heart. At the end of the song, he rewards you with a big gold bag.
outcomes.1: The minstrel, hating the actual power, by his song decides to make a revolution. He take you with him, drugs you, and makes you think that the rest of the people are on their way to the king's room. Unfortunately, one of the string of the mandoline breaks, and the music stops. You however are in the king's room, alone, with a fork. You immediately get arrested for madness.
outcomes.2: Perotin, knowing a bit your story to save the princess, decides to make you live the view of her mother for a day, so that you learn a bit more about this distressed woman. But the queen's life is boring for you, and appart from some gossips and thoughts of woman on her child, you don't get any useful informations because of the fact that those are caused by magic drugs of Perotin. At the end of the day, you take your body back, and continue your trip.

singRoyalty.text: Sing about the royalty, and the power in place.

outcomes.0: Perotin, sad of this request, decides to make you live the role of minstrel in the song and... You see yourself arriving, to ask your choice, but you force yourself to sing it, and it loops for a long time. At a moment, our favorite minstrel stops the song, and give you the antidote, to this hallucinatory poison. Afraid of what just happened, and of the duration of this loop, you run away to know what time is it. And... it's the evening now.
outcomes.1: Perotin, nostalgic, decides to tell his beginnings in the profession in his song. He tells how his master gave him his melodious lessons, and his softening drugs. You feel this sweetness in the teacher's words that inhibits you with all your being. At the end of his last lesson, Perissien, Perotin's master, decides to give you a present, as he had received from his predecessors, but to prevent this magical instrument, this mandolin, from leaving you since its beginnings, Perotin changes the end of the song in order to give you an object that could be useful to you for the rest of your adventure.
outcomes.2: The excellent minstrel Perotin decides to tell a dream he would like to live, whether real or hallucinated: at the beginning you are alone, in the village alley, with your guitar. You sing for yourself the joys of the work and the sadness of life, when a monarch passes in the main avenue. This one, hearing the beautiful melody, comes towards you and asks if you could create a song for him on the theme of his love. At the end of your sweet ballad just made up, he thanks you and gives you a big bag of gold, considering that this man was real. Happy with this music, you decide to share it with Perotin as a donation.

46.text: While crossing a small village, you found the most famous minstrel of the region, called Perotin. His is so good in his work, that he wanted to let you live a song, because of his powerful drugs. Having the courage of going talk to him, he would like you to choose the following theme. What do you suggest?

outcomes.0: You think about the villager's offer but do not answer it. He insists and you leave without saying a word, thoughtful.
outcomes.1: You do not react, and when your interlocutor leaves, you run away from the village so you don't get in trouble with the lord.
outcomes.2: You think about the villager's offer but you are quickly arrested by guards who overheard the conversation. Your protests do not save you one day in jail.

outcomes.0: You decide not to take part in this madness and leave as soon as possible. Unfortunately, you pass by a guard, hungry of wealth, that asks you to stop. You are quickly immobilized and stripped.
outcomes.1: You do not want to risk your life and so, decline the offer before leaving by thanking the villagers for welcoming you.
outcomes.2: You declare yourself exhausted, they find you a shelter for you to rest. You take advantage of the night to flee the village.
outcomes.3: You tell them that you cannot fight the Lord because you are exhausted. They agree to offer you shelter for you to rest. You take an item during the night and flee as quickly as possible.
outcomes.4: You tell the villagers that you are exhausted, and ask them to leave you a night in order to prepare. They accept and when the night falls, you gather your belongings and flee the village. In your rush you unfortunately drop part of your purse.

goAway.text: Do not take risks and leave as soon as possible.

outcomes.0: With the help of the whole village, you organize a siege of the castle. No reaction is observed in the castle, where people seem to be making do with the slight inconvenience caused by the blockade of surrounding roads. After a few hours, the drawbridge gates are lowered and some thirty men rush towards the camp you've set up. A bloody struggle ensues. In the rush, you grab a horse and run.
outcomes.1: You and the villagers plan a rebellion! Unfortunately, when you decide to attack a guard, the villagers are too frightened to follow you and flee. Your opponent gives you a violent strike that knocks you down, the guard takes advantage of the situation to steal your purse.
outcomes.2: You decide to organize an uprising! Tho, a villager betrays you to obtain a prize. The castle´s guards hasten to haunt you. You manage to distract them, not without having suffered a few blows.
outcomes.3: You take advantage of your knightly status to visit the squire. After the introductions, you reveal the reason for your visit by thrusting a dagger into his heart. The guards react immediately and surround you. One of them swings a sword at you, which you manage to dodge, but another rushes in and pierces you with his blade.
outcomes.4: You try to siege the lord's castle with the village but the night falls, therefore, you decide to sleep in front of the castle. The lord took advantage of the situation to go out with his man and reach the camp, but a villager alerts everyone. You rush on the lord and send him an agile sword strike. The guards surrender and the villagers give you a purse filled with gold to thank you for helping them!
outcomes.5: You go see the lord and announce him that his village is planning a rebellion. After a long discussion, you manage to gain his trust and seize the opportunity to pierce his heart with a dagger. The Lord's loyal guards rush on you and immobilize you. One of them propose to execute you in front of the villagers to get the message across, but the rebellion is raging! The villagers end up making the guards flee and offer you a large purse filled with gold to thank you.
outcomes.6: You go see the Lord and announce him that a rebellion is being planned. After a long discussion, you manage to gain his trust and seize the opportunity to pierce his heart with a dagger. The loyal guards attack you, but other's that only wanted the Lord's death help you flee. Back in the village, we offer you a bit of money and an item that could be useful.

help.text: Help the villagers dethrone the lord.

outcomes.0: You go visit the lord, tell him about the villager's request and help him find the person. He thanks you and you leave.
outcomes.1: You visit the lord and tell him of the treachery in the neighboring village, announcing that you are prepared to give him the names of the dissidents in exchange for a large sum of money. He accepts your offer and you lead him to the traitors, whom he executes before your very eyes. On the way, you check the purse he's given you and realize that it contains very few coins!
outcomes.2: You go visit the Lord and tell him about the villager's request and explain to him that you can help him find the rebel, but in exchange you want a nice sum of money. He accepts and asks you to help him find him. Together, you get there, but when you ask the Lord for the money, this one refuses. A duel begins but the lord is no match for your swordsmanship. However, he didn't have much wealth on him.
outcomes.3: You go visit the Lord, but the guards won't let you pass. You let them know that this is important, but they do not want to hear anything. Under their threats, you leave again with a swearing, helpless.
outcomes.4: You decide to tell the Lord what you've heard, but on your way you see a villager who seems to have guessed your intention to betray the village. You try to force the way but reinforcements arrive fast. Surrounded by the hating crowd, you get knocked down and severely struck.

tell.text: Tell the lord the plans of the village.

47.text: You have been so tired that you have trouble walking. This is when you see a village. Saved! Not without pain, you finally arrive to the village. From the sympathy of a group of villagers, you find a place to sleep and food to eat. You plan to leave soon, however, a villager asks you for a favor. Shining you with vast wealth, the villager requests you to help them dethrone the chatelain of the neighboring castle.

outcomes.0: You watch the knight, not knowing what to do about this colossus in armor. Finally, you get back on your way.
outcomes.1: You watch the knight, unsure of what to do in the face of this armored colossus. Summoning your courage, you confront him in a duel... and are miserably defeated by him. The knight demands your purse in exchange for your life.
outcomes.2: You watch the knight, unsure of what to do in the face of this armored colossus. Suddenly, you have an idea: you wait until it's dark and pitch-black before making your way discreetly towards the tower. The door is closed and the knight has disappeared. You climb the tower and enter through a window. You search it from top to bottom, but find nothing but food. You eat on the spot, taking as much as you can. Your meal has restored your strength and you're feeling better than ever.
outcomes.3: Not knowing what to do, you engage the discussion and sympathize with the knight. You gradually get the discussion on the artifact and enjoy your speaker talent in advance. The knight, convinced that you are worthy of possessing it, will get you the artifact. He brings it to you, as promised. You thank him and go to search for someone to buy it. You see what seems to be a merchant, but it was a thief shooting you an arrow in the leg. He steals the artifact from you and runs away. Blessed and helpless, you watch him running away with your loot.
outcomes.4: Not knowing what to do, you engage the discussion and sympathize with the knight. You gradually get the discussion on the artifact and enjoy your speaker talent in advance. Against all expectations, when you ask him about the artifact he refuses. Not wishing to bother him, you do not insist more and talk to the knight a little before you get back to your path.

outcomes.0: Ready to fight, but knowing little about your opponent, you approach him on the pretext of wanting to discuss an arrangement. Close enough to your enemy, you draw your sword and lunge at him. Unfortunately for you, the knight was on the lookout and possesses colossal strength, which he uses to disarm you before pushing you back to the ground.
outcomes.1: Ready to fight, but knowing little about your opponent, you approach him on the pretext of wanting to discuss an arrangement. Close enough to your enemy, you draw your sword and lunge at him. The knight hardly has time to react as you're already knocking him out with the pommel of your sword. But that's not enough. You strike him a second time and, this time, he collapses to the ground. You then try to open the tower door, but to no avail. You check the guard for the key, but he doesn't have it on him. So you leave, dejected.
outcomes.2: Ready to fight, but knowing little about your opponent, you approach him on the pretext of wanting to discuss an arrangement. Close enough to your enemy, you draw your sword and knock him out with the pommel. You then search the guard and soon find a key. Open the door. Once inside, you have no trouble finding the artifact. After an hour of searching, you find a merchant. He buys the artifact from you for the modest sum of five hundred gold coins.
outcomes.3: Ready to fight but not knowing your opponent, you come together on the pretext of wanting to discuss an arrangement. Close to your opponent, you draw your sword and knock him with the knob. Then you try to open the tower door but it is locked... You search the guard and quickly find a key. You open the door, inside you don't find any difficulty to find the artifact. So you go in search of a merchant and find one easily. He steals the artifact with a skillful move, but you also reach to steal one of his objects. Hoping that this one has value, you look at what it is.
outcomes.4: Barely knowing your opponent, you approach with the excuse of wanting to discuss an arrangement. Once close enough to your enemy you draw your sword to stun him with the knob. Unfortunately for you, the knight was far stronger and faster than you. The knight runs at you, makes a right hook and pushes you back by hitting you in the stomach with his foot before hitting you with a powerful uppercut. On the ground, on the edge of fainting, you are not able to get up.
outcomes.5: The knight brandishes his sword to intimidate you. Faced with this colossus, you hesitate to flee, but decide to stay. You will fight this knight, although your chances of defeating him are slim. Your opponent effortlessly parries your blows one by one, before knocking you to the ground. On the ground, unarmed, you know the fight is over. Then the knight says to you: "You're very brave, so here's your reward". He gives you an item before moving to the tower entrance.
outcomes.6: Ready to fight, you quickly lunged at your opponent, drawing your sword. The knight barely had time to draw his weapon before you charged at him. At that moment, you realize your mistake. He's wearing armour, but you're not. So you try to stun him with the pommel of your sword, several times. This seems to have disorientated him, so you prepare to try again. But before you can, your opponent wounds you in the leg. You're on the ground, unable to get up. The knight stands over you and raises his sword. You close your eyes and hear your own scream.

outcomes.0: You start talking to him, and find him very nice. You gradually steer the discussion towards his role here, he explains that he is the tower's guardian. You ask him if it is possible for you to enter, but he refuses. You get back on your way.
outcomes.1: You engage the discussion and talk for several minutes. The knight didn't say a word. Understanding that he will not talk, you abandon any discussion as you leave.
outcomes.2: You engage the discussion, the knight immediately orders you to move on. You don't want to leave, but as soon as he shows you his sword, you don't hesitate any longer.
outcomes.3: You start a discussion but the knight stays quiet. Understanding that any attempt to dialogue is useless, you leave.
outcomes.4: You start a discussion and spend over an hour with the knight. You gradually steer the discussion around the artefact and enjoy in advance your oratory skills. The knight goes away to get the artefact while you, obsessed by your triumph, do not notice the person behind you until he stabs you in the back. You fall to the ground.
outcomes.5: You engage the knight in discussion and attempt to sympathise for over an hour. He does not want to let you pass by in any way. With no other choice, you draw your sword and attack him. With no other choice, you draw your sword and attack him. The knight, insensitive to your blows thanks to his armor, hits you violently in the face before knocking you out with a stroke of his knob.
outcomes.6: You start a discussion and sympathize with the knight. You gradually steer the discussion around the artefact and enjoy in advance your oratory skills. The knight, convinced that you are worthy to possess it, goes to fetch the artefact for you. He brings it to you, as promised. You thank him and go looking for a merchant. You manage to sell it for the modest sum of five hundred gold coins.

48.text: You are looking for an artefact. You covet it because, according to legends, it offers wealth and power to its owner. After your quest has led you to a tower that is supposed to contain the treasure, you find yourself face to face with a knight in armor blocking the entrance. The latter stays impassive in spite of your injunctions...

outcomes.0: You catch it and swallow it in one fell swoop, it doesn't take you long to realize that not baking the poor creature was a mistake.
outcomes.1: You catch it and bake it, its flesh is delicious and enables you to regain strength for the journey.

outcomes.0: You watch the creature struggle with all its strength for a little time, then leave.
outcomes.1: The show is of no interest to you, and you're back on the road immediately.
outcomes.2: You continue without paying attention to the creature, clumsy, you step in a hole and twist your ankle. You will need to heal yourself.

outcomes.0: You get it back on its feet and then watch it go, proud to have done a good deed.
outcomes.1: Barely getting back on its feet, the little crustacean pinches your ankle and leaves in the direction of the water.
outcomes.2: You rush to his aid and watch him head back into the water. A few seconds later, you see a huge mass emerging from the sea. It's a chest full of gold, offered to you by a horde of these little crustaceans.

helpIt.text: Help it and put it back on its feet.

outcomes.0: You decide to take the little creature with you, but it pinches you violently in the face and hurries away.
outcomes.1: You decide to take the little creature with you. A few hours later, as you check on the frail creature, you discover a bloody heap at the bottom of your bag. The hermit crab has been crushed by the contents of your bag, so you spend ten minutes or so cleaning your bag and set off again.
outcomes.2: You decide to take the little creature with you. A few hours later, you find a small stream, decide to leave your little friend there and continue on your way.

49.text: After strolling along the beach for a few minutes, you come across a strange little creature - a hermit crab! It seems to have turned on its shell...

outcomes.0: You spent a good hour picking up the scattered coins from the bottom of the water, but it looks like it was all worth it!
Sometimes it's good not to be too lazy. You didn't waste any time!
outcomes.1: No time to rest! There's a princess to save!
outcomes.2: You choose not to stop and keep moving forward.
outcomes.3: You continue your adventure without paying any more attention to this fountain.
outcomes.4: You have to know to rest when you are tired. Exhausted, you collapse a few minutes after passing the fountain. You have to sleep before you can continue!

keepGoing.text: Do not stop and continue on your way.

outcomes.0: It feels good to rest sometimes... these 30 minutes of rest have been beneficial!
outcomes.1: It's good to rest sometimes... You spend an hour at the foot of the fountain before setting off again!
outcomes.2: It feels good to rest sometimes... but don't forget to move on! After wasting 3 hours resting, you are back on the road.

rest.text: Rest and drink to regain strength.

outcomes.0: You approach the villagers and ask them about these strange fruits. They explain to you that they are coconuts and that their flesh is eaten when the shell of the fruit is opened and that their juice is famous throughout the country. The villagers offer you to taste it and you do not say no to the offer. Indeed, the juice is refreshing and the chair soothes your appetite. You leave after having thanked the villagers for this discovery by giving them some coins and continue on your way.
outcomes.1: You approach the villagers and ask them about these strange fruits. As one of them explains to you, the others start to draw closer to you. Suddenly, someone gives you an arm lock while the others throw themselves at you to steal your things. After having been beaten beforehand, you resume your journey.
outcomes.2: You approach the villagers and ask them about these strange fruits. They explain to you that they are coconuts and that their flesh is eaten when the shell of the fruit is opened and that their juice is famous throughout the country. With this precious information, you hit the road again.

ask.text: Talk to the villagers to question them.

outcomes.0: You watch the villagers harvesting these unusual fruits for a while, then continue on your way under the blazing sun.
outcomes.1: One of the fruits falls beside you. You take it in your hands and examine it carefully before continuing on your way.

outcomes.0: After you have rested well, you decide to leave before the sunset.
outcomes.1: As you are about to leave, you realize that the group of villagers is heading towards you, they then begin to extort money from you and you give them money so that they leave you alone.
outcomes.2: You decide to leave, without a glance, you leave the Coco village to continue your quest.

leave.text: Leave the village without further waiting.

outcomes.0: You continue your nap, but one of the fruits comes loose and crashes down on your head. You're injured and bleeding badly. Some villagers spot you and come to your aid, but it will take a while for you to recover.
outcomes.1: You are sleeping for a moment. When you wake up to find that the sun is starting to set and the temperature is dropping, you resume your route, invigorated.
outcomes.2: You decide to continue your nap. When you wake up, you get up, ready to go, and notice that you are missing something in your pockets, it is your wallet. So you decide to leave, disappointed.

nap.text: Continue your nap at the foot of the tree.

50.text: During your trip, you reach a small hamlet named Coco Village, it is very hot and you need to rest. The places do not seem hostile to you, so you make a stop in this oasis. While you are resting at the foot of a coconut tree, you see a group of villagers climbing trees to catch fruits you've never seen before, they are round like balloons and hard like wood and do not seem appealing.

outcomes.0: The sun is about to set, so you settle down to rest.
outcomes.1: After hesitating for a long time about the possibilities available to you, you decide to try to climb half a dozen steps before changing your mind, finding the climb too perilous. As you pivot your foot back to go down, it slips and you roll down the stairs. You stand up painfully to see with difficulty that you are badly involved. You get back on your way, annoyed by this unfortunate incident.
outcomes.2: You sit down on the ground lined with clovers to think about what you want to do. Quickly, a fox faces you. He slowly approaches you and ends up reaching for one of your hands, puts his nose on it, yaps at you and runs away. You decide to follow the path this friendly animal has just blazed for you.

outcomes.0: Shortly after turning around, you meet a crying and scared little boy by the wayside. He explains to you that he fled during a bandit attack on his parents merchandise cart. You rush to offer your help, the child accepts immediately. After walking two long hours, you find the parents of the child alive, but hurted. As you bid them farewell, the mother gives you a purse filled with gold.
outcomes.1: Shortly after turning around, you meet a crying and scared little boy by the wayside. He explains to you that he fled during a bandit attack on his parents merchandise cart. You rush to offer your help, the child accepts immediately. After walking for a few minutes, a group of heavily armed bandit attacks you by surprise. This trap will not have been fatal to you, but you lose many gold coins during your escape.
outcomes.2: Shortly after turning around, you hear the clatter of pots and pans approaching you. It's a traveler in search of new culinary flavors, about to set up camp and rest. In the course of conservation, you discover her first name: Lucya. She offers you a pie that delights your palate. Full, rested and delighted by your chance encounter, you decide to continue on your way.

outcomes.0: You search for a few moments around the base of the stairs, without success. Two more steps let you discover a few gold coins scattered here and there among the weeds. Delighted with your skinny discovery, you continue your adventure whistling.
outcomes.1: After a handful of minutes searching the surroundings, you find a used leather satchel, almost entirely hidden under a heavy stone. By opening it, you discover a papyrus where only a few words are still legible: "staircase", "cave", "camp" and "Xetrix". This name sounds familiar to you, but especially disappointed not to have found any treasure, you resume your journey.
outcomes.2: Suddenly, when looking around, an enormous rock gets off celestrum mount and hits you in its fall. You don't even have time to react and look at the rock still falling, hitting you at the arm violently.

outcomes.0: You begin the perilous ascent of the staircase that leads to the entrance of a cave. You enter the cave and discover a very old, abandoned camp. Digging around a bit, you discover an object that you think will be useful in furthering your quest, and decide to carefully make your way back down the staircase.
outcomes.1: You begin the perilous ascent of the staircase which leads you to the entrance of a cave. You enter it and discover a very old abandoned camp. After having inspected the whole cave which turns out to be safe, you decide to settle there to sleep since there remains a rather comfortable bed of straw.
outcomes.2: After having carefully climbed a few steps lined with moss, you slip and tumble down the few meters that separate you from the ground. Slightly stunned and injured, you give up the idea of trying your luck again and continue your journey.

51.text: As you reach the bottom of the Mount Celestrum, you spot a tortuous staircase cut in the left side of the Mount. By getting closer, the steps turns out to be sharps and covered with moss.

outcomes.0: You refuse to play with children and go away.
outcomes.1: You refuse, and this has the consequence of annoying the children who pick up stones from the ground and throw them at you. In front of the rubble rain, you are forced to flee, out of reach of children. You realize that you have been hit in the head and the wound is bleeding profusely, you will need treatment.
outcomes.2: You refuse, and the children get angry. Seeing that the situation could turn sour, you quickly hit the road.

outcomes.0: Faced with your lack of respondent, the children lose interest in you and go to play elsewhere. So you resume your journey.
outcomes.1: Seeing you lost in your thoughts, the kids tie the laces together. When you come out of this trance state, you stumble and fall face down on the ground.
outcomes.2: You just sit there for hours, and when you come back to your senses, you realize your purse is gone. You continue on your way, annoyed.

outcomes.0: Not understanding the rules of the game very well, you are quickly put aside and resume your journey without the children worrying about you.
outcomes.1: You play with them until their parents arrive, finding you suspicious, they repudiate you from their village by threatening you. You get back on the road without asking for your rest.
outcomes.2: Playing the role of the runaway you are chased by the kids. As you look over your shoulder to gauge the distance between them and you, you trip over a root and injure yourself. Children leave you to your sad fate when they see your inability to continue playing. You will need to be treated.

outcomes.0: After playing for a while, the Kids notice that the Sun is setting and are forced to tell you good bye.
outcomes.1: During the friendly fight, one of the children hurts you superficially.
outcomes.2: Without doing it intentionally, you cut the cheek of one of the children... Embarrassed, you give him some coins so that he can pay for his care.
outcomes.3: Very energetic, the children keep you going in circles for a while. After twenty minutes, however, you finally put an end to the game.

outcomes.0: As you explain to the children how best to position themselves for the shot, one of them, a little way off, manages to string his bow and, before you can do anything, releases the arrow which goes straight into your leg. Wounded, you leave them to look for a place to heal.
outcomes.1: You explain to the children how to place themselves to shoot and the children do well. You spend the rest of the day training them in archery. Before you left them you were warmly thanked by a small present from your apprentices of the day. You leave them and resume your journey.
outcomes.2: You soon realize that the children are not yet strong enough to stretch the rope. So you tell them you'll come back and train them when they're older, and set off again.

teach.text: Teach them how to use a Bow.

52.text: While you are making a stopover at Boug-Coton, you are called out by children asking you to play with them.

outcomes.0: With nothing special happening on the road, you succeed in reaching the building where you have to deliver your package. A man comes out and hands you your due. You set off again for the next part of your adventures.
outcomes.1: You pick up the package and head off in the direction the courier points you. You quickly fall into an ambush and get robbed of the package and your purse. Still in shock, you decide to take a rest under a nearby tree.
outcomes.2: You take the package from the courier's hands and leave for the house he indicated to you. Arrived at your destination, you find yourself unable to locate the house despite long research. You finally decide to keep the object and continue your way.

outcomes.0: You Politely decline, explaining that you are occupied. You go to rest under a nearby tree.
outcomes.1: You refuse and the man apologizes for the inconvenience. You quickly change the subject and chat with him. After a few minutes of conversation, he offers you a snack. This little break won't have been a total waste of time, you made a friend.
outcomes.2: You politely reject the offer. The outraged man throws the package in your face and orders you to deliver it for him! You take the package for yourself and go away from this obnoxious character. You come out with a pretty bruise on your face and an item that will surely come in handy.

outcomes.0: You remain silent in front of man. He doesn't quite know how to react to your bliss. After 5 minutes, he decides to accost another man to have the package delivered to him.
outcomes.1: You hesitate then end up refusing and continue your journey without worrying about the future of this package.
outcomes.2: You have no answer to this proposition. The man is not disturbing you more when he understands that you will not accept his request. You leave it for continuing your journey.

outcomes.0: You take the package and store it in your bag. You assure the man that it will be delivered before nightfall. A bit later, you open the package and discover a beautiful painting. You continue on your way and come across a painting expert's building, where you decide to get the painting you just stole assessed. You show your work to the painter, who calls you every name under the sun. It was to him that the package was intended! You decide to compensate him and you apologize to him. Taken with remorse, you immediately return to your way.
outcomes.1: You take the package. On your road, you cross the path of an itinerant trader. You call out to him to buy the package. You get a very good price for it. You continue on your way, without any remorse.
outcomes.2: You promise to the courier to deliver the package and return to the inn that hosted you the night before. You decide to open the package in order to see the content and find out that it is completely empty. What a waste!
outcomes.3: You decide to steal the package and resell it. However, since you were not in a hurry, you decide to sit down near a river. You quickly joiny by what seems to be a wandering trader. Having no need for his trinkets, you offer to buy the package. The man, at the curiosity picked by your mysterious packet, accepts your offer. You will never know the contents of this package but the few pieces you have taken from it are enough for you.
outcomes.4: You leave with the package and tell the courier that it will arrive safely. A few minutes later you meet a woman who looks like a merchant. She explains to you that she has no money, but that she can exchange your package for an item from her cart. You trade the packet for an item you think it's useful and continuing your journey.

53.text: As you pass by the shore of Mirage Lake, you notice a man waving at you from a little farther away. Intrigued, you decide to join him. The man introduces himself to you as a courier and begs you to help him. You notice that he is exhausted and in a bad way. He asks you to deliver the package he has before nightfall to a secluded house nearby. He tells you that in exchange for this good deed, the man who receives the package will offer you a bag full of gold coins.

outcomes.0: You decide to organize bets but no one wants to take part, because everyone knows who the winner will be.
outcomes.1: You decide to place a bet that the knight won't win. Everyone comes to bet, because they all know he won't lose, but you have a plan in mind. You offer to fight for the lord of the manor. He readily accepts your offer. As expected, you win the fight and the bets. That's a lot of money.
outcomes.2: You decide to place a bet that the knight won't win. Everyone comes to bet, because they all know he won't lose, but you have a plan in mind. You offer to fight for the lord of the manor. He readily accepts your offer. As expected, you win the fight. As you ask the bettors for your money, they are displeased and decide to take it away from you.
outcomes.3: You decide to place a bet that the knight won't win. Everyone comes to bet, because they all know he won't lose, but you have a plan in mind. You offer to fight for the lord of the manor. He readily accepts your offer. You lose the fight, but refuse to give him your money. The villagers start following you, throwing various objects at you. Once away from the village, you're aching all over. You've also injured your leg, so you'll need to rest before continuing on your way.
outcomes.4: You place bets that the knight won't win. Many come to bet, because they all know he won't lose. The guards are watching you to make sure you don't steal the money. You offer to watch the duel with them, except for a few who will guard the place. They start arguing about who should stay, and you take advantage of the situation to take some of the money and speed off. They chase you but eventually give up, realizing they can't catch you. You look at the money you've collected, delighted with your move.
outcomes.5: You place bets that the knight won't win. Many come to bet, because they all know he won't lose, but you have a plan in mind. You offer to fight for the lord of the manor. He readily accepts your offer. As expected, you win the fight and go to collect the betting money. A villager attacks you on your way out of the village, certainly wishing to steal your money. After a tough fight, you manage to escape, but not without being seriously wounded. You'll need to rest now.
outcomes.6: You place bets that the knight won't win. Many come to bet, because they all know he won't lose, but you have a plan in mind. You offer to fight for the lord of the manor. He readily accepts your offer. You lose the fight, but you don't intend to lose your money that way. So you run off to the betting place and steal as much money as you can, pursued by the villagers, before fleeing the village.

outcomes.0: The discussions attract your curiosity so you decide to attend the duel. It quickly concludes with the foreign knight as the winner. Disappointed, you resume your way.
outcomes.1: The discussions attract your curiosity so you decide to attend the duel. It concludes very quickly. Disappointed, you propose to replay the duel, but this time it's you who will fight. Your proposal is accepted, in just a few seconds, you are disarmed and on the ground. Your opponent laughs at you, claiming that you are a patetic fighter. Absolutely furious, you run on him to beat him, but the knight knocks you out with the pommel of his sword.
outcomes.2: Not very well interested by this duel, you decide to not pay attention to it and continue your way.
outcomes.3: The discussions attract your curiosity so you decide to attend the duel. Close to it, you notice that bets are played so you decide to participate. Naturally, you bet on the foreign knight before going to attend the duel. It is actually the winner, but when you turn back for your earnings, everything has disappeared. Discontent to have you done so, you get back to your path.
outcomes.4: The discussions that attracted your curiosity, you decide to attend the duel, which concludes quickly. You suggest to now duel yourself, and they agree. You don't take a lot of time to defeat your opponent, the village acclames you and the Lord offers you a good meal, you gladly accept his offer. Once you are reputed, the Lord proposes doing you to become a knight, you politely refuse his offer and thank him for the delicious meal. You feel much better ahead.

outcomes.0: Understanding the Lord's distress, you offer him to participate in the duel. He willingly accepts it. The battle begins, you know there is no chance of defeating your opponent, but you try to resist anyway. It only takes a minute for him to defeat you. You get back on your way, shameful of your defeat.
outcomes.1: Understanding the Lord's distress, you offer him your help. You are then equipped before the duel begins. You fight valiantly but are just as easily overcome by your opponent. It is when he slashes you with his blade that you bitterly regret having offered your help. Indeed, it is a death match. And you just lost it. You close your eyes, and the pain goes away. You wake up a few hours later, seriously injured.
outcomes.2: Understanding the Lord's distress, you offer him your help. You are then equipped with an armor before the duel begin. Recognizing that you have no chance at all, you defend yourself the best you can. Your opponent, impatient, lowers his guard and you take advantage of it to attack him. You manage to put him to the ground before disarming him. You emerge victorious from the arena, the Lord comes to meet you to give you a purse full of gold. You thank him before you get back on your way.
outcomes.3: Understanding the distress of the Lord, you propose to him to settle the conflict by using your words. He promises you a reward if you succeed. Determined, you go to meet the knight once he arrives in the village and tell him that you want to negotiate with his lord. He accepts and he brings you at his home. You get on quickly with him and ask him to cancel the duel. You say to him that after that could takes place the negotiations to resolve the conflict. He accepts and you come back with him to Boug-Coton to announce the news. The Lord gives to you a purse filled with gold to thank you.
outcomes.4: Understanding the distress of the Lord, you propose to him to settle the conflict by using your words. He promises you a reward if you succeed. You meet the knight so that he takes you to his Lord. Once arrived, you get on quickly with him. Unfortunately, he still doesn't want to cancel the duel, even if he likes you. You come back to the the village with the knight to announce that the duel will takes place.
outcomes.5: Understanding the distress of the Lord, you propose to him to settle the conflict by using your words. He promises you a reward if you succeed. You meet the knight so that he takes you to his Lord. Once arrived, you try to negociate with him during many hours, unsuccessfully. Because of your vains efforts, you think to leave him. But before it, the Lord declare that he likes you, indeed, he added that he was impressed that you didn't give up. He propose to you to become knight but you decline politely his offer and resume your way.

help.text: Propose your help to the Lord of Boug-Coton.

outcomes.0: You decide to attend the duel. The foreign knight wins in only a few seconds. You don't wait to leave, disappointed by the mediocre performence of the loser.
outcomes.1: You decide to attend the duel. The foreign knight wins in only a few seconds. In front of the mediocre performance of the loser, you propose to replay the duel, but this time it's you who will fight. Your proposition is accepted, you can fight. Your opponent, too much sure of him, lowers his guard during the fight. You don't wait a second to take advantage of it and take the advantage. You finish by defeat the knight et announce your win. He proposes doing you to become knight but you decline politely his offer and resume your way.
outcomes.2: You decide to attend the duel. The foreign knight wins in only a few seconds. In front of the mediocre performance of the loser, you propose to replay the duel, but this time it's you who will fight. Your proposition is accepted. The battle begins, and despite all your efforts you managed, you arrive to resist only around ten seconds.
outcomes.3: You decide to watch the duel. It's over in a matter of seconds. In view of the loser's mediocre performance, you propose to replay the duel, but this time you'll be the one fighting. Your proposal is accepted, and you can fight. Your overconfident opponent drops his guard while you fight. You don't wait a second to gain the upper hand. You finally defeat the knight and announce your victory, triumphant. The lord of the manor offers you a purse full of gold, which you gladly accept.
outcomes.4: You decide to watch the duel. It's over in a matter of seconds. You call the loser incompetent and propose to replay the duel, but this time it's you who'll be fighting. The loser suggests you come and fight him before criticizing. You accept his request, knowing full well that you'll have no trouble defeating him. Being overconfident, your opponent manages to disarm you before knocking you to the ground. He then beats you until you faint. Seriously injured, you'll need plenty of rest.
outcomes.5: You decide to watch the duel. It's over in a matter of seconds. In view of the loser's mediocre performance, you propose to replay the duel, but this time it's you who will be fighting. Your proposal is accepted. The fight begins, and despite your best efforts, you only manage to resist for about ten seconds. The knight decides to hit you again and again, to make you understand that you're just an insect against him. After seriously wounding you, he stops and leaves.
outcomes.6: You decide to watch the duel. The foreign knight wins in just a few seconds. In view of the loser's mediocre performance, you propose to replay the duel, but this time it's you who'll be fighting. You win the duel after a few minutes of combat. The lord of the manor suggests a chat over a good meal. You gladly accept, as the food is delicious and plentiful. Once you've eaten your fill, the lord offers you a knighthood. You politely decline.

outcomes.0: You visit the village but, seeing nothing of interest, you leave without further ado.
outcomes.1: You visit the village. Seeing nothing interesting there, you decide to go and watch the duel.
outcomes.2: As you visit the village, the Lord notices the adventurer you are. He explains the situation and begs you to take part in the duel. He will offer you a purse full of gold if you win. You accept his offer and go for the fight. But once the duel begins, you understand you don't stand a chance against your opponent. The knight hurts you in the leg with his sword and you miserably fall to the ground, wounded. Unable to stand up, you lose the duel.
outcomes.3: You visit the village and see an object at the bottom of the well. You pick it up before getting back on your way.

54.text: ️You see the village of Boug-Coton and decide to go there. Once you have arrived you hear rumours about a duel against a knight. You soon understand that there is conflict between the lord of these lands and that of the neighbouring village. To solve it, a fight is organized between their best combatants, but all here are mediocre and the duel begins soon.

outcomes.0: You decide to climb the tree because you think that it's the faster way to do it. In a few seconds, you are in the other side, free to continue your way.
outcomes.1: You climb the trunk, however you are not enough careful: you wounded yourself with the rough tree's bark and fall. You have to retry your climbing. At the second time you did it, but your hand is very painful.
outcomes.2: You find that climb is a good idea so you do it. When you arrive at the other side, you note the presence of four peoples, armed and they are waiting for you. Because of your numerical inferiority, you don't hesitate to give them your possessions to live.

outcomes.0: You take an axe from your bag and cut down the tree. It took you 30 minutes to clear your way!
outcomes.1: You begin to cut down the tree and take a long time to cut the totality of it. You go to the nearest village, borrow a wain and his horse and carriage, come back to the forest, and load the cut wood in the wain, come back to the village, and sell it to the cabinetmaker. It's only after all that you discover that a wain and his horse and carriage are more expensive than the wood of only one tree!
outcomes.2: You want to cut down the tree, but you realize that you don't have any tool. So you decide to climb the tree and did it without problems. You continue your road.

cut.text: Cut down the tree and continue.

outcomes.0: Not knowing what to do, you finally decide to climb the tree. Within seconds, you are on the other side, free to continue on your way.
outcomes.1: Not knowing what to do, you remember that you entered the forest a while ago, so you decide to retrace your steps.
outcomes.2: While you are hesitating on what to do, you hear footsteps in your back! You barely have the time to turn around before four men jump on you. You faint almost instantly, and get up a few hours later, stunned and with a much lighter purse.

outcomes.0: You prefer to slightly change your route. You climb the embankment of the path where you were on, and pass some meters that way. After having passed the tree, you come back down on the path and resume your way.
outcomes.1: You decide to change your route. To do so, you climb the embankment of your way and progress in the forest. You find, on a dead body, a beautiful item and a lot of money. Knowing that it will be more useful for you than the body, you take it and continue your forest hike.
outcomes.2: You think that climbing the tree is too dangerous and you don't have anything to cut it. As a result, you have to change your route. But because of your poor sense of direction, you manage to lose your way. It's not until nightfall that you only managed to get out of the forest.

55.text: Certainly due to yesterday's big storm, a tree has fallen on the small path where you are walking. Its trunk is a good 3 meters thick, it's blocking your path!

outcomes.0: You approach the turquoise sea with the firm intention of taking a midnight swim. Leaving your belongings at the water's edge, you will swim a few fathoms before returning to the sand. You angrily notice the disappearance of some of your money as well as the charlatan's tent.
outcomes.1: As you wander among the rocks, you spot a horde of these little crustaceans famous for their great presence on this beach. You observe them for a few moments before heading back.
outcomes.2: Not having eaten yet, you decide to take advantage of this beach's resources in order to fill your empty stomach a little. As you search under a stone for crustaceans, a large bird takes flight and catches the hermit crab you just spotted. Startled, you take a step back, your foot slips and you thrust your ankle in the rocks.

beach.text: Ignore the alchemist and go enjoy the beach.

outcomes.0: Considering that it's easy money, you agree to become Gruffo's guinea pig. He gives you a steaming, blackish liquid. After having drunk a few unsavory sips of it and having waited for what seems like an eternity, you suddenly start vomiting followed by violent convulsions. It will take you almost forty minutes to come back to your senses before resuming your adventure.
outcomes.1: Considering that this is easy money, you agree to become Gruffo's guinea pig. He gives you a vial containing a coal-coated liquid. Once drunk, the liquid immediately plunges you into a deep sleep. You wake up three hours later, comfortably installed on a coconut tree branch. At its foot, you discover an enamelled purse filled with gold!

outcomes.0: Not without a hint of concern, you accept Gruffo's proposal. He gives you a tan-colored vial. Thinking of the financial compensation, you decide to drink it all at once. Immediately, a burning sensation invades your throat. After ten minutes or so, you stammered, hardly seeing anything. You are completely drunk! Strongly nauseous, you try to strike a blow at Gruffo who easily dodges it. Not one to hold a grudge, he makes you comfortable on his bench. You pester the stunted charlatan alchemist for a moment before he deigns to keep his side of the bargain.
outcomes.1: You impulsively accept, while refusing any amount of money from Gruffo. Indeed, participating in a potential scientific discovery swells you with honor! The alchemist hands you a tiny vial filled with a crimson liquid. It takes only one sip to empty the contents, and you feel a pleasant warmth spreading throughout your body. Here you are in much better shape!
outcomes.2: Lured by greed, you enthusiastically accept Gruffo's proposal. You quietly drink the scarlet liquid handed to you by the alchemist. Once done, Gruffo gives you a disappointed look while justifying that his experimental drink has an immediate effect. While promising you that you won't be sick, he throws you out of his tent. A little bitter not to see the shadow of a penny, you decide to continue your journey.
outcomes.3: With suspicion and apprehension, you decide to drink in one go the sapphire-colored beverage that Gruffo hands you. Immediately, a freezing cold grips your entire body. As you painfully call Gruffo a shriveled charlatan, he settles you into a heap of warm blankets.

outcomes.0: You end up accepting Gruffo's enticing offer. This one asks you to wait a little while, while he brings you your liquid. Just as you are carefully studying a still, a powerful blow lands on your pretty skull.
outcomes.1: In front of your inert attitude, Gruffo gets impatient and throws you out of his tent, making you pay for the time you wasted. You get back on your road in no time!
outcomes.2: Faced with your inability to make up your mind, Gruffo does not insist and offers you a cup of black tea. You discuss for many minutes about everything except alchemy! You resume your way as the moon timidly lights up the beach.

outcomes.0: You prefer to politely decline Gruffo's offer while wondering how to find a safe place to sleep. Seeing your worried face, Gruffo suggests that you stay in his tent until the sun rises. You accept wholeheartedly and fall asleep, serene.
outcomes.1: You refuse to serve as a guinea pig for the alchemist. He then offers you to create your own potion and taken aback by this new proposal, you accept. After some research, you end up making a translucent liquid. You hesitate a few moments before drinking your mixture all at once. Long minutes later, you are overcome by dizziness and funny hallucinations where you see your dear princess. Almost an hour of rest will be necessary to allow you to resume your adventure.
outcomes.2: You categorically refuse the alchemist's proposal. He seems disappointed, so you decide to have a chat with him for a while. During the discussion, you ask him where all his alchemical knowledge comes from and it is with a touch of bitterness that he gives you the name of this famous minstrel known throughout the all country: Périssien. However, Gruffo will not answer you about the location of his master. Not wanting to insist, you thank him for this interesting conversation and decide to get back on your way.

56.text: You approach Sentinel Beach, the fresh air fills your lungs and the salty smell of the sea reaches your nostrils. As you go forward, the sea breeze strengthens and the sound of seagulls can be heard. The sun is starting to set, you need to find a safe place for the night. A few more steps allow you to discern a tent pitched on top of a dune. Upon entering, a man called Gruffo explains to you that he is an alchemist looking for a volunteer to test his new substances, in exchange for a substantial sum of money.

outcomes.0: You enter the river and turn right to follow the current. The water is cool and it makes you feel a lot better.
outcomes.1: You put one foot in the river and then the second. You begin your progress in the river. After walking for a few minutes, you arrive at a small one-meter-high waterfall and decide to jump down. As you gain your momentum, the stone where your right foot is resting on moves and you fall to the bottom of the waterfall, hitting your skull twice. You are still conscious, although strongly stunned.
outcomes.2: You have been walking for a good hour when you arrive again to a crossroads. You decide to continue on dry land.

continue.text: Continue your way by walking in the water.

outcomes.0: You sit down by the river. The water is cool and you decide to put your feet in. After a few minutes of pure bliss, a sharp pain sends your feet hurtling out of the water. You see a huge crab clinging to your foot. You feel a sharp pain, but you're about to have a delicious, invigorating meal.
outcomes.1: You're hungry. You look into the river and spot those famous gigantic crabs. There are two species. One red-orange and one red and black. You hesitate and decide to try your luck with the big red-orange ones. After preparing and wolfing them down, you start to feel hot and sweaty. You realize your mistake too late: you've chosen the non-edible species.
outcomes.2: You're walking in the river when you trip. You knock yourself out. Luckily, the current is strong and you end up on the riverbank. You're stunned, but alive.

outcomes.0: You look into the river and spot a few fish and crabs. You build a makeshift trap and set it in the water. After 10 long minutes, your trap contains 2 nice crabs and a small fish. You build a fire and grill them. You feel invigorated after eating them.
outcomes.1: You see at the bottom of the water strange creatures that you had never seen before. They are fitted with two claws and move sideways. You assume that these are the famous things that gave this river their name and remember that they are edible. You decide to catch a few of them. You dip your hand in and manage to catch some, but they attack you with their chelae. You end up injured with a nice gash in your hand, but also with enough to make you a delicious meal.
outcomes.2: You hesitate for a moment between the fish in the river and the mulberry trees. Finally, you decide to prepare a feast. You prepare a fish trap and, after installing it, you go pick some blackberries. Salmon with blackberries, a treat!

findMeal.text: Find something to prepare you a meal.

outcomes.0: You decide to sit on a flat rock and contemplate the magnificent landscape with a thousand colors for a few hours before continuing on your way.
outcomes.1: You are tired by all these kilometers traveled and observe the river and its fiery-colored crabs. Minutes go by without you noticing. It's been an hour now that you are daydreaming like this.
outcomes.2: You lean against a tree and, feeling your eyelids grow heavy, you fall asleep. You wake up a few hours later but you are so relaxed that your walk is much more vigorous and you're soon caught up.

57.text: You are walking under an azure blue sky. The air is gentle and you continue on your way while listening to the bird songs, the trees creaking, the ground rustling under your feet. Suddenly, the sound of a river is heard in the distance. You continue your way to the river.

outcomes.0: You ignore the woman's advice and continue on your way.
outcomes.1: You continue on your way. Two kilometers further on, you collapse from exhaustion.

outcomes.0: You think for a long time and then, not knowing what to do, continue on your way.
outcomes.1: Exhausted, you decide to set up your camp here and continue the journey later.

outcomes.0: You arrive at the alchemist. He's known as Gruffo and offers you a recovery potion for a few coins. You accept and quietly drink the potion. A comforting warmth radiates within you. Invigorated, you start running so fast that you get to your destination without any delay.
outcomes.1: You arrive at the alchemist. He's known as Gruffo and offers you a recovery potion for a few coins. You decline the offer and quietly continue your journey.
outcomes.2: You enter the alchemist's lair. He's known as Gruffo and offers you to taste one of his new potions for free in order to test the effects. You drink the brew and feel a sense of comfort emanating from within you. You describe the effects to the man and come out of the hut, invigorated.
outcomes.3: You enter the alchemist's lair. He's known as Gruffo and offers you to taste one of his new potions for free in order to test the effects. You drink the brew and spit it out straight away, but there seems to be some poison still deep in your throat.

outcomes.0: You follow the indicated path until you find yourself facing a river with a dilapidated bridge over it. You hear it cracking, but that doesn't worry you until the moment you see the wood crumbling under your feet.
outcomes.1: You follow the indicated path until you find yourself facing a dangerous river with a dilapidated bridge on it. Not being very brave by nature, you decide to turn back. This will have cost you a good 10 minutes.
outcomes.2: You follow the indicated path until you find yourself facing a river with a dilapidated bridge over it. You hear it cracking, but it doesn't worry you. The rest of the crossing goes smoothly. You even find a few coins along your way!

58.text: After long hours of walking through the marshy road, you meet a woman at a crossroads. Exhausted, you ignore her but she, seeing your condition, calls out to you. She offers two paths that may be useful to you: one leading to an experienced alchemist who can get you back on your feet, the other being a shortcut.

outcomes.0: Um... Looks like you've been sitting there doing nothing longer than expected!
You're not the type to risk wasting time on meaningless exploration! You finish eating and move on.

goAway.text: Keep moving, no time to lose!

outcomes.0: You get quickly lost in this maze, but you end up coming out of it after a few hours!
outcomes.1: You spend a few minutes exploring the cave from top to bottom and find an object that may be useful...
outcomes.2: The cave soon turns out to be a cul de sac, but as you emerge, you hit your head on the ceiling and fall dizzy! You'll need medical attention!

outcomes.0: After 30 minutes, you finally discover a strange object...
outcomes.1: After 60 minutes, you end up abandoning your search without having discovered anything...
outcomes.2: As you began your search, you drop a large bag of coins at the bottom of a large hole! It can't be retrieved anymore...
outcomes.3: As you were looking for items to pick up, a huge branch breaks off from the tree next to you and falls on your leg! You manage to get up, stunned, but you'll have to recover!

6.text: You've stopped off in a cave to eat, and you're reluctant to leave again...

outcomes.0: You listen patiently to the king before being escorted back to the entrance. You are also given some information about a few additional missions entrusted to you by the king to facilitate your quest (order {command:missions}) and offered transport to the capital of your choice.

Once you have finished reading, you are taken back to the entrance. Someone also gives you some information about some additional missions entrusted by the king to facilitate your quest (with the {command:missions} command) and someone offers you transport to the capital of your choice.

60.text: You are brought to the large reception room of the castle where you quickly meet the king. Someone explains to you the nature of the competition, which is to collect a large number of points in order to dominate the rankings. In addition to a nice starting bonus, you receive a beautiful book that is supposed to guide you during your adventure. You open the book (https://guide.draftbot.com/en) and quickly check the first pages...

outcomes.0: You don't react to the guard's invitation. After a few moments, the young woman finally reaches you and gives you some advice. Among other things, you learn that the {command:report} command will give you all the information you need about your trip.

The young woman introduces herself and quickly follows up with some initial advice which you listen to carefully, you learn that the {command:report} report allows you to get all the information about your trip.

You admire the immense walls of the castle. After a while, the young woman finally reaches you and gives you some advice. You learn that the {command:report} command allows you to get all the information about your journey.

61.text: **Hello and welcome to DraftBot! {emote:other.crown} The king is looking for a noble knight to marry off his daughter, and you've chosen to take part in the selection competition! Having just arrived at the castle entrance after a long journey, you signal your presence to the guards at the entrance. You're invited to enter, and soon meet a young woman who seems eager to welcome you.

outcomes.0: You refuse the peasant's request with such a lack of sympathy that he ends up stoning you!
outcomes.1: You refuse the peasant's request with such courtesy that he wishes you a good continuation for your adventure!
outcomes.2: You decide to ignore the peasant's request. As you walk for several minutes, you see a road lined with impressive cherry trees. A few red cherries seem to reach out you. After tasting a few, you resume your journey.

outcomes.0: Seeing you unresponsive, the peasant seems quite annoyed but lets you leave without insisting. You find a lost wallet on the edge of a path. When you open it, you discover two small pieces of dried bacon.
outcomes.1: Seeing the peasant's desperate face, you decide to start looking for its fork. You end up at the edge of a fallow field where cattle quietly eat fresh grass. Suddenly, a tawny-colored dog springs up from the premises of the pasture and gets on you. Faster than it takes to say so, you knock the dog out and get on your way like nothing happened.
outcomes.2: While you agreed to help the peasant, you feel something buzzing in your ear and stick your little finger in. A sharp pain grabs you: a bee just stung you! You leave this stinging place without further ado.

outcomes.0: After watching cattle chewing fresh grass in the first wild grass stretch from a distance, you head for the second. Many sheep graze peacefully. An impressive oak dominates the pastures and attracts your attention, so you decide to approach it. A few meters from the tree, you notice a fork against the trunk. The peasant seems overjoyued when you give it back to him. He then grants you, as promised, a small purse filled with gold.
outcomes.1: As you approach the pastures, you notice footprints. Following them, you enter a dark grove containing a gloomy hut, to say the least. Curious, you walk around the building and come face to face with the much sought-after pitchfork! Retracing your steps in the opposite direction, you hand the object over to the farmer, who is full of thanks and invites you to share his meal so you can tell him all about your investigation. It's a pleasant evening, and you leave the farmer late into the night, invigorated by the local produce.
outcomes.2: As you approach pastures, you notice footprints crossing the land leading to an enclosure where sheep benefit from the refreshing shade of young oaks. You decide to follow the footprints, thinking they'll lead you to the fork. When you arrive in the middle of the sheep, one of them comes to you. In a playful mood, you show him your hand with a bit of grass in it. He benefits of it to satiate himself, biting your finger while eating. Irritated, you decide to flee this place. Approaching the edge of the pasture, you do not see the fork on the ground, and walk over it. Furious about this misfortune, you are thinking about not helping anyone anymore on your adventure.

outcomes.0: After a moment's hesitation, you decide to look for the famous fork on the edge of the vineyard. A tempting bunch of grapes catches your eye, and you decide to grab it. The farmer appears out of nowhere and, seeing you with a piece of his harvest in hand, howls in anger. Frightened, you let go of your harvest and take off!
outcomes.1: No sooner have you arrived in the vineyards than you come across the famous fork. After returning it to the farmer, he keeps his promise to you.
outcomes.2: As soon as you enter the vineyards, you spot a small wooden hut. As you enter, you discover a few barrels and several bottles of wine, one of which has already been opened. A few sips wouldn't have done you any harm if only you'd managed to limit yourself to a small quantity. You find the wine delicious, but don't want to waste any more time looking for a fork. You continue on your way, taking care to avoid the farmer.

outcomes.0: After several minutes of searching the field, you find the fork, barely visible, under a number of wheat plants lying on the ground. To thank you, the farmer offers you your reward, as promised.
outcomes.1: After three hours of searching, the fork is still nowhere to be found. You do, however, discover an object that may prove useful in winning the heart of your beloved Princess!
outcomes.2: As you are looking for the fork, you step on it and get a nasty cut. You take your time to inform the peasant that you found his fork. He, noticing your wound, hastens to heal you the best he can.

62.text: A peasant hails you while you're passing in front of his farm on the outskirts of the Expanse. It is made of pastures, vines and wheat fields. Looking downcast, he greets you and explains that he has lost his favorite fork. He begs you to help him find it while promising you a large reward.

outcomes.0: You chose to simply watch the fireworks and stay to see the village fall into despair, leaning against a tree just outside the village. But, even after midnight, nothing happened. It seems these so-called beasts are nothing but a sham, and you leave.
outcomes.1: You decide to watch the attic from the local tavern, but get distracted by some delicious beer. You black out, drunk, and lose your consciousness. Upon waking up, you notice that they simply tossed your unconscious body onto the road and that you are a few coins short.
outcomes.2: Deciding not to do anything, you enter the local tavern and rent a room for the night. But during your slumber, figures dressed in black attack you, beating you into submission and robbing you. They leave you bleeding on the floor and warn you to never snoop around in their affairs again...
outcomes.3: Since you are already there, you think to yourself: why not go shopping? You wander around the local market, visit the local black- and weapon smith. After some time, you find something.

outcomes.0: You make your way to the basement of the attic and come face to face with black-robed figures standing in a circle, covered in feathers and blood everywhere. As you try to hit one of them, you hesitate. These men are ordinary cockfight punters, not beasts. But the men notice you and, out of fear, gang up on you, knock you down and quickly flee.
outcomes.1: Upon entering the room, a mortifying stench of decay overwhelms you. Blood and detritus are spread throughout the room and some sort of red mist creeps around. Everything probably began to rot days ago. You can't stand the sight or smell and flee from the place with a deep sense of disgust.
outcomes.2: When opening the door, you find three black-robed shapes about to sacrifice a maiden. You quickly draw your blade and slay these culprits. Casting the blood stained blade aside, you rescue the damsel in distress and get her outside. The next day, you are celebrated as a hero and protector from evil.
outcomes.3: Upon going downstairs, you find yourself surrounded by oddly shaped wooden statues, twisted in some crude demeanor, horrors of the unknown made of wood. But there's nobody there. After investigating the creepy room, you find a box with something inside...

outcomes.0: Even after uncovering the dark machinations, you decide to abandon the helpless folks and leave them to their demise.
outcomes.1: You take off running, not knowing when the whole village will be swallowed by death if it is. In your haste to escape, you stumble and fall into a ditch.
outcomes.2: After dashing out of the village, you take a short rest to catch your breath. While doing so, you are approached by some armed figures dressed in black. Seems like they didn't like you snooping around the village. They draw their weapons and attack. Catching you off guard and exhausted, they beat you into unconsciousness.
outcomes.3: You make it out of the cursed village alive. After some time, you stumble upon a beautiful piece of untouched land. You can see a waterfall and multiple tamed carnivores. You decide to meditate under the stream of falling water. After an hour, you feel energized and continue your journey.

goAway.text: Get out of there as fast as possible.

outcomes.0: You find figures dressed in black in the aforementioned basement. They don't seem to be beasts, but ordinary people betting on cockfights. You join them and bet on the red rooster who, in the end, lost. Which makes you a few coins lighter.
outcomes.1: You find figures dressed in black in the aforementioned basement. They don't seem to be beasts, but ordinary people betting on cockfights. You join them and place your bets on the blue rooster who, in the end, won. A few coins richer, you leave the men to their games and leave.
outcomes.2: You meet 4 black-hooded men in the basement. After convincing them to let you join them, they reveal their plan of sacrificing the local folks' vital force to a devil they worship. Hoping to take advantage of their knowledge, you say you're willing to participate. You and the cultists sacrifice a girl and some animals. Furthermore, you spread their innards throughout the room. Yet nothing happens. After wasting your time, you angrily stomp away...
outcomes.3: You meet 4 black-hooded men in the basement. After convincing them to let you join them, they reveal their plan of sacrificing the local folks' life force to a devil they worship. Hoping you'll take profit of their knowledge, you say you're willing to participate. You and the cultists sacrifice a woman and some animals. Furthermore, you spread their innards throughout the room. Yet nothing happens. It's only when you walk away from the room that you stumble upon guards...

helpThem.text: Try to find the cultists in order to help them.

outcomes.0: Without checking for yourself, you start running around the village like a madman, screaming at everyone that they'll die if they stay. General panic ensues and everyone starts to leave the perimeter. But after a while, nothing happens, and some people aren't too happy about your bad joke. They gang up on you, beat you up and rob you.
outcomes.1: You tell the guards where the malevolent entities are hiding. They follow up on your tip and, after some minutes pass, another guard approaches you. It seems that heretics were about to kill a fair maiden and, thanks to your hint, she was saved. He hands you a small pouch before shaking your hand.
outcomes.2: After telling everyone about the dark misfortune that is about to hit the village, everyone packs up their stuff and stays just outside in the forest. When suddenly an earthquake hits and panic ensues. You help the guards calming down the masses which, after some time, quiet down. You are warmly thanked for the warning.
outcomes.3: You try to convince everyone that they're in danger, but people don't want to know and simply ignore you. You try for several hours and finally decide to leave them. You continue on your journey, unconcerned by the stubborn people of this village.

warnEveryone.text: Revealing to everyone what it's all about.

63.text: After some time, you finally arrive at Boug-Coton where some supposedly unholy creatures are into something... After investigating the place for a couple of days, you find a clue. There are reports of weird sounds and sightings of figures dresed in black going in and out of a barn's basement. Seems that a dark ritual is underway...

outcomes.0: You accept the invitation, you are jovial just at the thought of celebrating in the King's sumptuous castle. You stride towards the imposing building.
Parties aren't for you. You decide you've got better things to do than have fun and head off on your own adventure.
You didn't expect to read this. You stay for long minutes contemplating the letter. The departure of the messenger pulls you out of your daydream, and you take the destination of the castle.

64.text: No sooner have you arrived at your destination than a messenger stops breathlessly in front of you and hands you a missive. You carefully read the contents, which indicate that the King is preparing a great feast in his castle, and that you are invited to attend.
